org.teatrove.trove.util
Class SecureReadWriteLock

java.lang.Object
  org.teatrove.trove.util.SecureReadWriteLock
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReadWriteLock
public final class SecureReadWriteLock
extends Object
implements ReadWriteLock

SecureReadWriteLock prevents threads from accidentally releasing locks on behalf of other threads. A thread can only release as many locks as it has acquired. In addition, IllegalStateExceptions are thrown when a thread attempts to acquire a lock in a fashion that is deadlock prone.

Threads requesting write locks are given priority over those requesting weaker locks. Without this priority, many read threads can easily starve the threads requesting write locks.

SecureReadWriteLock is fully re-entrant. A thread may request a lock of equal or lesser strength as many times as it likes, provided that a release is performed as many times. 

 lock.acquireWriteLock();
 lock.acquireReadLock();  // works because thread already has stronger lock
 ...
 lock.releaseLock(); // read lock released, original write lock still kept
 lock.releaseLock(); // release original write lock

Author:
Brian S O'Neill

acquireReadLock

public boolean acquireReadLock(long timeout)
                        throws InterruptedException
A read lock is obtained when no threads currently hold a write lock. When a thread has a read lock, it only blocks threads that wish to acquire a write lock.

A read lock is the weakest form of lock.

Specified by:
acquireReadLock in interface ReadWriteLock
Parameters:
timeout - milliseconds to wait for lock acquisition. If negative, timeout is infinite.
Returns:
true if the lock was acquired.
Throws:
InterruptedException

Throws:
InterruptedException
IllegalStateException

acquireUpgradableLock

public boolean acquireUpgradableLock(long timeout)
                              throws InterruptedException,
                                     IllegalStateException
An upgradable lock is obtained when no threads currently hold write or upgradable locks. When a thread has an upgradable lock, it blocks threads that wish to acquire upgradable or write locks.

Upgradable locks are to be used when a thread needs a read lock, but while that read lock is held, it may need to be upgraded to a write lock. If a thread acquired a read lock and then attempted to acquire a write lock while the first lock was held, the thread would be deadlocked with itself.

To prevent deadlock, threads that may need to upgrade a read lock to a write lock should acquire an upgradable lock instead of a read lock. Upgradable locks will not block threads that wish to only read.

To perform an upgrade, call acquireWriteLock while the upgradable lock is still held.

Specified by:
acquireUpgradableLock in interface ReadWriteLock
Parameters:
timeout - milliseconds to wait for lock acquisition. If negative, timeout is infinite.
Returns:
true if the lock was acquired.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if thread holds a read lock.
InterruptedException

acquireWriteLock

public void acquireWriteLock()
                      throws InterruptedException,
                             IllegalStateException
Same as calling acquireWriteLock(getDefaultTimeout()).

acquireWriteLock in interface ReadWriteLock
Throws:
InterruptedException
IllegalStateException

acquireWriteLock

public boolean acquireWriteLock(long timeout)
                         throws InterruptedException,
                                IllegalStateException
A write lock is obtained only when there are no read, upgradable or write locks held by any other thread. When a thread has a write lock, it blocks any thread that wishes to acquire any kind of lock.

A write lock is the strongest form of lock. When a write lock is held by a thread, then that thread alone has a lock. Requests for write locks are granted the highest priority.

Specified by:
acquireWriteLock in interface ReadWriteLock
Parameters:
timeout - milliseconds to wait for lock acquisition. If negative, timeout is infinite.
Returns:
true if the lock was acquired.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if thread holds a read lock.
InterruptedException

releaseLock

public boolean releaseLock()
Release the lock held by the current thread.

Specified by:
releaseLock in interface ReadWriteLock
Returns:
false if this thread doesn't hold a lock.

getDefaultTimeout

public long getDefaultTimeout()
Returns the default timeout used for acquiring locks. If negative, the timeout is infinite.

Specified by:
getDefaultTimeout in interface ReadWriteLock

getLockType

public int getLockType()
Returns the lock type held by the calling thread, which is NONE, READ, UPGRADABLE, or WRITE.

getLockAcquisitions

public int getLockAcquisitions()
Returns the number of times this thread has acquired a lock. The releaseLock method would need be called this many times to release all the locks.

getReadLocksHeld

public int getReadLocksHeld()
Returns the number of threads that hold read locks.

getUpgradableLockHeld

public Thread getUpgradableLockHeld()
Returns the thread (if any) that is holding the upgradable lock. It can be interrupted to stop a deadlock.

getWriteLockHeld

public Thread getWriteLockHeld()
Returns the thread (if any) that is holding the write lock. It can be interrupted to stop a deadlock.
